definition: to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
variant of 燙|烫[tang4]/variant of 趟[tang4]

sentences.english: It was like a shower of roses falling athwart this house of mourning.
sentences.chinese: 那好象是阵荡涤悲哀的玫瑰雨。

sentences.english: Almost every way of life in the medieval period was washed away by the tide of change.
sentences.chinese: 改革浪潮荡涤了中世纪生活的几乎每个方面。

sentences.english: Many years ago his home was a popular children's songs, is still clean up my mind today.
sentences.chinese: 多年前家乡曾经流行的童谣，时至今日仍荡涤脑海。

sentences.english: It took us hours to clean the greasy kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 咱们花了多少个小时荡涤到处是油污的厨房。

sentences.english: Let one's soul be pierced and cleansed , again and again.
sentences.chinese: 在这里，让灵魂一次又一次被美丽刺穿，荡涤。

sentences.english: So it will be cleansed of the whole social life each corner.
sentences.chinese: 所以它也必将荡涤整个社会生活的每一个角落。

sentences.english: The rain quickly laid the dust.
sentences.chinese: 雨水很快荡涤了空中飞扬的尘土。

sentences.english: The music seems to purify one's spirit of evil thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 这种音乐似乎能够荡涤人们心灵中的邪念。

sentences.english: Let the soul be pierced and cleansed , again and again.
sentences.chinese: 在这里，让灵魂一次又一次被美丽刺穿，荡涤。

definition: to wash away/to eliminate/to do away with
to cleanse/to scrub/to scour/to wash down/to erode/to wash away
to rinse/to wash/to clean/to purge/to comb out
turbid flow/muddy waters/fig. a contemptible person/fig. corrupt or disgraceful social trends
to be contaminated/to be gradually influenced
miscellaneous/mixed and disorderly (of writing)/disordered and confusing/mixed-up and illogical
